Articles.Content:
Some how it fixed its self, no idea why. But im not having this issue anymore.

Thanks to all that helped.

Hello,

This is a last ditch effort as I've tried basically everything.

This issue is that the game just wont "load", by that i mean that it will open but stay on a white screen forever (I've left it for over 2 hours before).

My current setup is:

Windows 7

Intel core i7 4790k @ 4GHz

16GB ram.

Nvidia Evga SC 980ti (Latest drivers)

SSD (where ksp is installed)

Things I've tried:

Complete reinstall the game from steam.

Delete everything manually, then re-download from steam.

Reinstall graphics drivers.

Use beta drivers.

Leave it running.

Edited October 23, 2015 by ArcticVoid
English
Try manually deleting the files and then reinstalling from steam (delete from your files app), I find that helps sometimes if a steam reinstall doesn't work.

Try manually deleting the files and then reinstalling from steam (delete from your files app), I find that helps sometimes if a steam reinstall doesn't work.

Yeah that's what I meant by complete reinstall.
Another white screen? I think you need to look here...

Another white screen? I think you need to look here...

I took a look.

While his issue seams to be the same, the solution didn't work.

I have left it on the white screen for over two hours before while I did something

else and when I came back it was still on the white screen.

(by do something else i mean leave the computer, and just left ksp to run, and kept it in-focus.)

Edited October 23, 2015 by ArcticVoid
English

He reinstalled his OS, not just KSP or Steam.

We will need your KSP logs and dxdiag hardware report, and you should test your other games in case this is not isolated to KSP.

Of most interest will be your DirectX info.

See here for details.

He reinstalled his OS, not just KSP or Steam.

We will need your KSP logs and dxdiag hardware report, and you should test your other games in case this is not isolated to KSP.

Of most interest will be your DirectX info.

See here for details.

Are you using anything else after starting KSP?

ArcticVoid, please upload the output_log.txt from the KSP_Data folder to pastebin, it should contain more information.

I will also need to know what processes are running when you start KSP, you can take screenshots of your taskmanager and put them on imgur.

Your dxdiag is confusing, it is showing three NVIDIA GeForce GTX 980 Ti cards, which may mean you have multiple registry entries for this card.

When updating a graphics driver there can be problems if the previous driver is not fully removed, and this can only be done when the system is rebooted after the current driver is uninstalled, the system needs to be rebooted again after the new driver is installed so the driver can start correctly.

You could try running a registry cleaner like ccleaner to remove duplicate and old entries, that should clear up dxdiag if nothing else, and may fix your KSP issue.
